sentences.en: A national Athenian spirit at last began to overtake tribal loyalties.
sentences.cn: 雅典的民族精神,也最终超越了忠于部落的境界.

sentences.en: Athenian lawmaker ( 7 th century ) whose code of laws prescribed death for almost every offense.
sentences.cn: 雅典立法者 ( 7世纪 ),他的法律条文对每一项犯罪都处以死刑.

sentences.en: ATHENIAN: Why, my friend, I am actually amused by my own recent mood.
sentences.cn: 雅典人: 呃, 我的朋友, 我最近实际上对自己的情绪感到好笑.

sentences.en: C. Socrates was executed by the Athenian court on charges of atheism and corrupting the youth.
sentences.cn: 公元前399年, 苏格拉底被雅典法庭判处死刑,其罪名是宣传无神论和腐蚀青年.

sentences.en: In retaliation, Poseidon dragged him before a group of Athenian judges for trial.
sentences.cn: 于是, 他毫不留情地把他干掉了.

sentences.en: On the economy, developing the navy can protect the Athenian trade.
sentences.cn: 经济上, 发展海军可以保护雅典的海上贸易.

sentences.en: She was encased in Athenian armor, safe from emotional injury.
sentences.cn: 她穿戴着雅典娜的盔甲, 这样她就不会受到感情上的伤害.

sentences.en: The Peloponnesian war. terminated in the ruin of the Athenian commonwealth ( Alexander Hamilton )
sentences.cn: 伯罗奔尼撒战争以雅典同盟的毁灭而收尾 ( 亚历山大汉密尔顿 )

sentences.en: This is already the case in the Athenian and Roman property classes.
sentences.cn: 在按照财产状况划分阶级的雅典和罗马,就已经是这样.

sentences.en: We can gain a great deal of enlightenment from the thought of Athenian harmony education.
sentences.cn: 雅典和谐教育思想对我国的教育有很大的启示,对我们教育中的关于人的全面发展问题有借鉴价值.

sentences.en: When they were grown and able to do for themselves, he joined the Athenian army.
sentences.cn: 当他们长大成人,能自食其力时, 他参加了雅典军队.

sentences.en: You will know the man by the Athenian garments he wears.
sentences.cn: 你可以由他穿的雅典服饰认出他.

trans.tran_cn: 雅典的，雅典人的，雅典文化的
